title.narrative: Provide primary care health services and strengthen the capacity to respond to infectious disease outbreaks of cholera, acute watery diarrhoea and dysentery to affected populations of Tropical Cyclone Gombe and flood-affected population in Mozambique

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving primary healthcare services to IDP populations in the Nampula and Zambezia provinces of Mozambique affected by Tropical Cyclone Gombe. This will entail containing infectious disease outbreaks of cholera, acute watery diarrhea, and dysentery; preventing further expansion in other areas and strengthening the capacity to respond to outbreaks of these diseases. This will be accomplished through the procurement and distribution of Interagency Emergency Health Kits, the deployment of health care workers to support PHC through MHB in the affected districts, the deployment of mobile health brigades to provide basic health care in hard-to-reach areas in affected districts, and through undertaking joint supportive supervision in the affected hospitals and health facilities. More specifically, the project will also provide a timely response to diarrheal/cholera and dysentery disease outbreaks by providing training for 70 health care workers on the following: cholera, acute watery diarrhea, dysentery, malaria surveillance, contact tracing, and case management. It will also provide training for health care workers and lab technicians on ‘rapid diagnostic test testing’ for cholera/acute watery diarrhea. Another essential component will be the deployment of WHO country office staff to the affected districts to monitor disease conditions, conduct outbreak investigations, and respond to potential cholera/ acute watery diarrhea cases. The targeted beneficiaries, for this component, total 23,408 people, including 27,308 women, 25,900 men, 16,800 children and 3249 persons living with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provide primary care health services and strengthen the capacity to respond to infectious disease outbreaks of cholera, acute watery diarrhoea and dysentery to affected populations of Tropical Cyclone Gombe and flood-affected population in Mozambique

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS MOZAMBIQUE RAPID RESPONSE STORM 2022

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Provision of PHC services to the affected districts
